author: HT Correspondent
title: Drive to plant 3 crore saplings to begin soon: CM Mann - Hindustan Times
text: Chief minister Bhagwant Mann on Thursday said it was the need of the hour to enhance the forest cover in the state. Chairing a meeting to review the forestation drive in the state here at his office, Mann said the state government has set a target of planting around 3 crore saplings for which a massive drive will be started in the coming days. Mann said farmers can play a proactive role for transforming this campaign into a public movement, adding that as the food growers have made the country self-reliant in food production, they can play a major role in enhancing the green cover. The CM said 1.2 crore saplings were planted last year. He asked the deputy commissioners to identify vacant government land in their respective districts for ensuring massive plantation. The CM said the DCs should personally monitor the plantation drive at the ground level. He said there were 14.01 lakh tube wells, adding that if every farmer plants four saplings then the forest cover will be enhanced considerably.

author: @ukrinform
title: Ukraine’s advances in Kursk region jeopardize Putin's legitimacy - Canadian expert
text: Ukraine’s advances in Kursk region jeopardize Putin's legitimacy - Canadian expert That’s according to Andres Kazekamp, a professor at the Munk School of Global Affairs at the University of Toronto, who spoke on CBC Radio. Putin likely feels that his own regime and legitimacy are in jeopardy, the scholar believes. As the Russian president portrays himself as the defender of his people and the Russian Empire as such, the way the Ukrainians humiliate him naturally puts pressure on him, the expert adds. [Ukraine’s high-precision airstrike hits Russian stronghold in Kursk region](/rubric-ato/3897827-ukraines-highprecision-airstrike-hits-russian-stronghold-in-kursk-region.html) He noted that Putin tends to avoid publicity when things don't go his way. During the first few days of the Ukrainian raid, Putin was nowhere to be seen in public as he had no answers to offer. In general, he was caught off guard, Kazekamp said. The expert believes the only way to peace is through Ukraine's victory on the battlefield. [Kremlin launched information campaign to diminish losses in Kursk region - ISW](/rubric-ato/3897565-kremlin-launched-information-campaign-to-diminish-losses-in-kursk-region-isw.html) The ongoing war is not about the territory, he stressed, as the Russians seek complete domination over Ukraine. As Ukrinform reported earlier, Ukraine’s Defense Forces are pursuing an offensive in Russia’s Kursk region, having already gained control of over 1,000 square kilometers and more than 80 settlements. Photo: epa.eu

author: Mary Walrath-Holdridge
title: Kathleen Wilson's Minnesota dentist did 30 procedures at once: lawsuit
text: A Minnesota dentist has become the subject of a malpractice lawsuit after his patient accused him of "disfiguring" her. The civil lawsuit was filed in Hennepin County, Minnesota last week by Kathleen Wilson, who alleged Dr. Kevin Molldrem and Molldrem Family Dentistry caused her significant injury that is still being corrected. According to the suit, Molldrem performed more than 30 producers on Wilson in a single July 2020 visit, doing eight crowns, four root canals and 20 fillings in one go. The lawsuit alleges that the dentist "perform[ed] this work improperly," resulting in pain and suffering, embarrassment, emotional distress, and disfigurement. Molldrem was likewise accused of using improper levels of anesthesia during the procedures and falsifying medical records to cover it up. “It is inconceivable that Dr. Molldrem could have prepared and placed 8 crowns under these circumstances in the time allotted, not to mention the additional 20 restorations,” wrote Dr. Avrum Goldstein, a dentist and expert witness brought on by Wilson's attorney, in an affidavit. Goldstein, who is a faculty member at NOVA Southeastern University , also wrote that Wilson had been correctly diagnosed as having a "rare condition" causing decay in almost all of her teeth, but Mollderm's course of action was not a proper form of treatment. "[Wilson’s] required a slow, thoughtful, careful and measured response to her disease,” he said in his report. “Trying to fill every hole in every tooth in her mouth in one visit is not only the antithesis of what was indicated, it is not humanly possible to achieve in an effective or constructive manner.” Doctors remove wrong organ from man: They opened him up to remove his appendix. They mistakenly took out much more, lawsuit says. The lawsuit also accused Mollderm of tampering with medical records to falsify the amount of anesthesia that was reportedly used, which in reality was nearly double the standard number of units, according to court paperwork. According to Goldstein, the maximum dose of anesthesia given in three hours should not exceed 490 mg, but Molldrem's records show he gave Wilson 960 mg. “Any negative cardiovascular or central nervous system outcomes could be tied to the local anesthetic overdose," he wrote. Wilson said in the suit that she has since had to have the dental work completely redone by other dentists to repair Molldrem’s “negligent work," an ongoing process that has caused her to lose income and rack up medical bills on top of enduring pain, suffering and embarrassment. She is seeking more than $50,000 in damages. Wilson's attorney and Molldrem did not immediately respond to request for comment.

author: Prerona Datta
title: ATMA 2024 Registration for July Session Open @atmaaims.com; Apply till July 13
text:
ATMA 2024 registration started for July session on apply.atmaaims.com. Candidates must enter their name, e-mail address and phone number to register. The last date to register is July 13, 2024.
New Delhi: The
AIMS Institute of Management has commenced ATMA 2024 registration for the July session on the official website @atmaaims.com. Eligible candidates interested in appearing for the July session can register on the official portal by July 13, 2024. The exam is scheduled to be conducted on July 21, 2024.
|
|
Direct Link:
Candidates must enter their name, mobile number, and email ID to register. The last date to pay the registration fees is July 11, 2024.
ATMA 2024 is an eligibility test for admission to Maharashtra's MBA, MMS, and PGDM programs. The ATMA exam is conducted multiple times every year. The paper has 180 MCQ questions based on Analytical Reasoning, Quantitative Reasoning, and Verbal Skills.
What are the Important Dates for ATMA 2024 July Exam?
Candidates can check the important dates for ATMA 2024 July exam:

How to Register for the ATMA 2024 July Exam?
Candidates can follow the below-mentioned steps to apply for the ATMA 2024 exam for the July session:
Step 1: Visit the official website of ATMA AIMS at atmaaims.com
Step 2: On the homepage, click on ‘Enroll for ATMA’.
Step 3: On the new page, enter your name, date of birth, city, email address and mobile number.
Step 4: Then, Pay the required application fee and proceed to fill out the complete ATMA 2024 application form.
Step 5: After the application fee payment, upload the necessary documents.
Step 6: Submit the ATMA application form.
Step 7: Take a printout of the form for future reference.
Frequently Asked Questions
Ques. What is the registration fees for ATMA 2024 registration?
Ans. Candidates must pay INR 2000 (General), INR 1000 (North East), and INR 500 (Women) online as a registration fee for ATMA 2024.
Ques. When will the ATMA 2024 July exam results be declared?
Ans: The ATMA 2024 results will be declared on July 28, 2024.
Ques. What are the documents required for ATMA 2024 registration?
Ans. The following documents are required for ATMA 2024 registration:
- Digital Copy of passport-size photograph and signature of the applicant.
- Digital Copy of Class 10th, Class 12th, and Graduation mark sheets.
- Digital Copy of latest OBC (Non-Creamy)/ SC/ ST/ DAP category certificate as applicable.
- Sponsored candidates must upload a sponsoring certificate as per the format available on the official ATMA website.
Ques. How many marks are required in Graduation to be eligible to appear for ATMA 2024?
Ans. Candidates must obtain at least 50% marks in their graduation to be eligible to apply for ATMA 2024.

author: Obituaries
title: Melvin K. Shook
text: Melvin K. Shook, 91, passed away peacefully at the home of his son, Jeff, where he has been in home hospice since February, on Tuesday, July 8, 2025. He was born and raised in Seville and was a 1952 graduate of Elyria High School. He met and married his high school sweetheart, Jean Ruth (nee Clement) in 1954. Mel worked at the Chronicle-Telegram delivering newspapers, moved into the pressroom, and eventually became production manager until his retirement in 1996. Mel and Jean retired to Florida in 1999. They enjoyed traveling all over the United States and saw all 50 States. They also loved going to casinos and visiting family and friends. After Jean passed, Mel moved back to Ohio and has lived with his son, Jeff and his wife, Marilyn for the past three years. Mel is survived by his daughter, Ellen Phillips; sons, Dean (Denise) and Jeff (Marilyn); grandchildren, Dean Lee, and Misti. He was preceded in death by his wife, Jean in 2020; parents, George and Bessie Shook; brother, Philip; sisters, Rena Good and Belva Berry; stepbrother, Richard Cleckner; stepsister, Betty Pilarczyk; and multiple nieces and nephews. There will be no services per Mel's request. In lieu of flowers, family requests memorial contributions be made to the American Heart Association or Buckeye Hospice in Mel's memory. The family wishes to thank the nurses, aides, social workers and doctors at Buckeye Hospice for the care of our Dad during this time. Arrangements have been entrusted to the Laubenthal- Mercado Funeral Home and Cremation Services of Elyria. Online condolences may be expressed at www.laubenthalmercado.com
